marketNews.title: Toyota: Still the World's Best Seller, but New Scandal Emerges
marketNews.content: Toyota Motor Corp. (TYO: 7203) on Monday (29/1) announced it will temporarily halt shipments for 10 car models due to diesel engine certification issues. The problem arose after an investigative committee found that the affected models had differences in horsepower output and Engine Control Unit (ECU) devices compared to those used during the certification test. Based on a release from Toyota Motor Corp., one of the affected car models is the Toyota Fortuner produced by PT Toyota Motor Manufacturing Indonesia (TMMIN). Responding to this issue, TMMIN Vice President Director, Bob Azam, claimed that this case is not related to cars in Indonesia. Bob explained that the problem relates to certification procedures in several countries other than Indonesia. Bob also stated that the issue is neither related to nor affects vehicle safety and the amount of emissions produced by the vehicles. Toyota's diesel engine certification issue occurred just a month after the scandal involving its subsidiary, Daihatsu Motor Co., which was proven to have manipulated safety tests for 64 car models. As a result, Daihatsu will stop shipments and halt operations at least until February 2024. Amidst these scandals, Toyota Motor Corp. announced that its global sales realization reached 11.2 million vehicles in 2023, a growth of +7.2% YoY. This realization makes Toyota the world's best-selling car manufacturer for 4 consecutive years. Sales of Toyota and Lexus brand vehicles reached 10.3 million vehicles in 2023. Of this figure, sales of Hybrid Electric Vehicles (HEV) for Toyota experienced a significant increase of +31.4% YoY to 3.4 million units, while sales of Battery Electric Vehicles (BEV) only reached 104 thousand units. For comparison, Toyota's competitors in the BEV segment - namely BYD and Tesla - recorded battery electric vehicle sales of 1.57 million units (+72.8% YoY) and 1.81 million units (+38% YoY) respectively during 2023.

marketNews.title: Social Protection Budget Reaches Rp496.8 Trillion, Potential All-Time High
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that the social protection budget in the State Budget (APBN) 2024 reached 496.8 trillion rupiah, an increase of +12.02% YoY from 2023 realization and potentially an all-time high record. Yusuf Rendy Manilet, Economist at the Center of Reform on Economic, stated that the acceleration of social assistance disbursement at the beginning of the year will have a positive impact on budget absorption. Nevertheless, Yusuf mentioned that social assistance disbursement during the political year risks misuse by certain parties.

marketNews.title: Finance Minister projects 2023 economic growth around 5%
marketNews.content: Finance Minister, Sri Mulyani, estimated Indonesia's economic growth in 2023 to be around +5% (vs. target: +5.3%). BPS will only release the official 2023 economic growth data on February 5, 2024. For 2024, the government targets economic growth of +5.2%.

marketNews.title: Rupiah Expected to Remain Stable Despite Previous Decline
marketNews.content: Finance Minister, Sri Mulyani, said that the rupiah exchange rate will remain stable with an upward bias, supported by the weakening US dollar amidst expectations of a Fed interest rate cut. On Tuesday (30/1), the Rupiah strengthened +0.27% to the level of 15,784 per US dollar. Previously, the Rupiah exchange rate briefly fell to its lowest level in the last 2.5 months at 15,845 on Friday (26/1), following media reports that Sri Mulyani might resign ahead of the 2024 presidential election.

marketNews.title: Government Opens Opportunity to Raise Rice Highest Retail Price (HET)
marketNews.content: Deputy III for Economy at the Presidential Staff Office, Edy Priyono, stated that the government is opening the opportunity to raise the highest retail price (HET) for rice. This discourse emerged because the current HET no longer reflects the actual rice price, with disparities reaching 30.26%.

marketNews.title: IDX Plans to Change LQ45 Rebalancing Frequency to Every Three Months
marketNews.content: IDX Director of Development, Jeffrey Hendrik, stated that his party plans to change the rebalancing frequency of the LQ45 index from once every 6 months to once every 3 months. Jeffrey mentioned that this plan is currently being studied and if approved, its implementation will start in March 2024.

marketNews.title: IDX Announces Major Evaluation for IDX High Dividend 20 Index Effective Feb 5, 2024
marketNews.content:
IDX announced the major evaluation of the IDX High Dividend 20 index, which will be effective from February 5, 2024, to February 4, 2025. Here are the details:
  - Included: BRPT, ICBP, INKP, KLBF, SMGR, TPIA, UNVR
  - Excluded: BJBR, BJTM, BNGA, BSSR, HEXA, HMSP, MPMX

tickerNews.title: ASII faces negative sentiment from Daihatsu scandal and BYD entry, but financial impact is deemed minimal
tickerNews.content: The issue adds negative sentiment to ASII shares, which have been under selling pressure in the last month due to the Daihatsu safety scandal issue and the entry of BYD into Indonesia. Nevertheless, we assess that the impact of this issue on ASII's finances will be minimal, considering the contribution of Toyota Fortuner is only about ~3% of ASII's total domestic sales in 2023. The potential impact from the export side is also relatively small, considering ASII only has ~5% ownership in TMMIN. On the other hand, the popularity of Toyota's Hybrid Electric Vehicle (HEV) sales also occurs in Indonesia. We assess that this trend can help ASII maintain market share amidst increasing competition in the electric car segment. On Tuesday (30/1), ASII shares strengthened +3.45% to the level of 5,100/share, but have weakened -9.73% in the last 1 month.

tickerNews.title: HRUM through subsidiary acquires 60.7% stake in Westrong Metal Industry for US$215.22 Million
tickerNews.content: HRUM: Harum Energy through its subsidiary, PT Harum Nickel Industry, acquired 1.21 million (60.7%) shares of PT Westrong Metal Industry (WMI) worth approximately 215.22 million US dollars. After this transaction, HRUM's ownership in WMI increased from 20% to 80.7%. WMI itself owns a smelter with a production capacity of 56,000 tons of nickel matte per year in Weda Bay Industrial Park, which is expected to commence commercial operations in 2Q24.

tickerNews.title: BSDE surpasses 2023 marketing sales target, achieving Rp9.5 trillion
tickerNews.content: BSDE: Bumi Serpong Damai recorded marketing sales growth of +8% YoY to 9.5 trillion rupiah during 2023, exceeding the target (108%) set at 8.8 trillion rupiah. The residential segment contributed 53% of this amount, followed by land plot sales to joint ventures (20%), shophouses (15%), commercial properties (8%), and apartments (5%). Quarterly, marketing sales in 4Q23 grew +40% QoQ to 2.75 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: INCO's 4Q23 nickel matte production reaches 19,084 tons, 2023 production exceeds target
tickerNews.content: INCO: Vale Indonesia recorded that nickel matte production in 4Q23 reached 19,084 tons (+6.3% QoQ, +17.9% YoY). Throughout 2023, nickel matte production grew +17.7% YoY to 70,728 tons, surpassing the target of 70,000 tons.

tickerNews.title: DSNG 2023 fresh fruit bunch (FFB) and CPO production increased YoY
tickerNews.content: DSNG: Dharma Satya Nusantara recorded that fresh fruit bunch (TBS) and CPO production during 2023 reached 2.27 million tons (+2.6% YoY) and 661,892 tons (+3.5% YoY) respectively. Quarterly, TBS and CPO production in 4Q23 reached 623,387 tons (+6.4% QoQ) and 187,969 tons (+10.8% QoQ). CPO sales volume during 2023 increased +4% YoY to 665,041 tons, with the average selling price growing +1.9% YoY to 11.39 million rupiah per ton.

tickerNews.title: AMOR to distribute interim dividend of Rp18.5 per share
tickerNews.content: AMOR: Ashmore Asset Management Indonesia will distribute an interim dividend of 18.5 rupiah per share. Cum dividend in the regular and negotiation markets on February 7, 2024, with payment on February 23, 2024. Referring to AMOR's share price at the closing of Tuesday (30/1) trading at 1,025 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 1.8%.

tickerNews.title: IDX Index Constituent Changes: BRPT, ICBP, INKP, KLBF, SMGR, TPIA, UNVR enter IDX High Dividend 20; BJBR, BJTM, BNGA, BSSR, HEXA, HMSP, MPMX exit
tickerNews.content:
IDX announced the major evaluation of the IDX High Dividend 20 index, which will be effective from February 5, 2024-February 4, 2025. Here are the details:
  - Masuk: BRPT, ICBP, INKP, KLBF, SMGR, TPIA, UNVR
  - Keluar: BJBR, BJTM, BNGA, BSSR, HEXA, HMSP, MPMX
